definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: An international radiotelephone signal word used by aircraft and ships in distress.
sentences.chinese: 遇險後，船員立刻發出求救信號。

sentences.english: This was the emergency call from the house where he was living.
sentences.chinese: 消息來自於他現居住的住所的緊急求救電話。

sentences.english: Because Qin has shouted loudly prays for rescue, Sun then chokes to death it.
sentences.chinese: 由於秦某一直高喊求救，孫某便將其掐死。

sentences.english: If you can't get back to the beach, tread water and wave for a lifeguard's help.
sentences.chinese: 假如你無法游回岸邊，可踩水並向救生員揮手求救。

sentences.english: Your body only then not because will hug thin lacks the energy to send out the distress signal.
sentences.chinese: 你的身體纔不會因爲細抱缺乏能量而發出求救信號。

sentences.english: Reports of cell-phone calls from the few survivors pleading for help.
sentences.chinese: 據報道幾乎沒有倖存者用手機求救。

sentences.english: At night send out the signal for rescue continously to the direction for rescue with the flashlight.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚用手電筒，向求救方向不間斷的發射求救信號。

sentences.english: At night send out the signal for rescue continously to the direction for rescue with the flashlight.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚用手電筒，向求救方向不間斷的發射求救信號。

sentences.english: When the call for help comes in, the heavy-duty tow truck is ready to haul any car or truck back for repairs.
sentences.chinese: 當求救有，重型拖車準備長途任何汽車或卡車回修理。

sentences.english: He continued his rounds for the next 30 minutes before seeking help.
sentences.chinese: 他繼續送30分鐘信，才向人求救。

sentences.english: Make sure you have a whistle to signal for help.
sentences.chinese: 確保您有哨子，以便發出求救信號。

sentences.english: Bae Joo-Mi, a clinical psychologist at the Korea Youth Counseling Institute, said the number of calls for help has grown over the years.
sentences.chinese: 臨牀心理學家白珠美說，求救電話過去幾年來增加了。

sentences.english: A great fish swallows him, but he prays for deliverance and the fish spews him out on dry ground.
sentences.chinese: 他被大魚吞喫，但他因禱告求救，被魚吐到旱地上。

sentences.english: The drifting ship appealed to the rescue team for help.
sentences.chinese: 漂流着的船向搶救隊求救。

sentences.english: BingYin failed over the wall was hung on the wall, call for help.
sentences.chinese: 丙寅翻牆失敗被掛在牆上，呼叫求救。

sentences.english: The ship radioed a call for help.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船用無線電發出求救信號。

definition: to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
to save sb's life/(interj.) Help!/Save me!
to rescue/to help out of difficulties/to save the situation
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
